title: Carlinville man in custody after allegedly shooting two teens
content:
CARLINVILLE - A 43-year-old Carlinville man is accused of shooting two teenage boys, critically injuring one of them, early Sunday.
Jason Hart was being held Monday at the Macoupin County Jail on a charge of aggravated battery with a firearm in connection with the shootings.
The teens were initially taken to Carlinville Area Hospital and then transferred to HSHS St. John's Hospital and Memorial Medical Center in Springfield.
One of the teens was treated and released, while the other remains in critical condition, Police Chief David Haley told the Alton Telegraph.
The Carlinville Police Department said in a news release that Joy Hart, 33, of Carlinville called 911 at 1:48 a.m. Sunday, saying her husband, Jason, had someone at gunpoint near the fence in the 500 block of Johnson Street.
Arriving officers located Jason Hart standing near two teens on the ground, the release stated.
Police discovered that one of the teens had a gunshot wound. A second teen found nearby also had been shot. In all, four teens that were believed to be involved were located, police said.
The release gave no indication of what the teens were doing at the time they were confronted by Hart.
The case remains under investigation.
